knimeNode.name: RDKit Add Conformers
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a new table with multiple conformers per input molecule.

fullDescription.intro: Creates a new table with multiple conformers per input molecule. Each conformer is a copy of the molecule with different coordinates assigned. Each conformer row is mapped back to the input table molecule with an identifier - usually the row id - taken from an input table column.
fullDescription.option: The input column with RDKit Molecules.
The input column with reference data to be assigned to conformer rows.
Number of conformers to be generated.

option.name: Conformer Calculation - Maximum number of tries to generate conformers

fullDescription.option: Maximum number of tries that the RDKit will use to generate conformers.
A random seed to initialize random number generator.

option.name: Conformer Calculation - RMS threshold for keeping a conformer

fullDescription.option: The RMS threshold for keeping a conformer.

option.name: Output - Column name for molecules with conformers

fullDescription.option: The output column with the generated conformers.

option.name: Output - Column name for copied reference data

fullDescription.option: The output column with reference data taken from the input table.

option.name: Advanced - Use random coordinates as a starting point instead of distance geometry

fullDescription.option: Setting this flag will use random coordinates as a starting point instead of distance geometry.

option.name: Advanced - Multiplier for the size of the box for random coordinates

fullDescription.option: Specifies a multiplier for the size of the box for random coordinates.
